    A functional interface for formatting elements of an array.

    • printArray

      public static void printArray(byte[] array)
      Print an array to the system standard out. .toString() is called on each element.
      Parameters:
      array - the array to print.

    • printArray

      public static void printArray(byte[] array, ConsoleUtils.ArrayFormattable<Byte> formatter)
      Print an array to the system standard out. 
       
 ConsoleUtils.printArray(array, (element, index) -> {
     return element + " at " + index;
 });
      Parameters:
      array - the array to print.
      formatter - the formatter used to format each element when printing.

    • print2DArray

      public static void print2DArray(byte[][] array)
      Print a 2D array to the system standard out. The outer array is used as y-axis and the inner array is used as x-axis. .toString() is called on each element. If the passed array is empty nothing gets printed.
      Parameters:
      array - the array to print.

    • print2DArray

      public static void print2DArray(short[][] array)
      Print a 2D array to the system standard out. The outer array is used as y-axis and the inner array is used as x-axis. .toString() is called on each element. If the passed array is empty nothing gets printed.
      Parameters:
      array - the array to print.

    • print2DArray

      public static void print2DArray(byte[][] array, ConsoleUtils.Array2DFormattable<Byte> formatter)
      Print a 2D array to the system standard out. The outer array is used as y-axis and the inner array is used as x-axis. If the passed array is empty nothing gets printed. 
       
 ConsoleUtils.print2DArray(array, (element, x, y) -> {
     if (y % 2 == 0) {
         return " " + ConsoleANSICode.paint(element.toString(), ConsoleANSICode.BG_BLUE);
     } else {
         return " " + ConsoleANSICode.paint(element.toString(), ConsoleANSICode.BG_CYAN);
     }
 });
      Parameters:
      array - the array to print.
      formatter - the formatter used to format each element when printing.

    • print2DArray

      public static void print2DArray(short[][] array, ConsoleUtils.Array2DFormattable<Short> formatter)
      Print a 2D array to the system standard out. The outer array is used as y-axis and the inner array is used as x-axis. If the passed array is empty nothing gets printed. 
       
 ConsoleUtils.print2DArray(array, (element, x, y) -> {
     if (y % 2 == 0) {
         return " " + ConsoleANSICode.paint(element.toString(), ConsoleANSICode.BG_BLUE);
     } else {

     }
 });
      Parameters:

      formatter - the formatter used to format each element when printing.
